title: What Is the Debt Ceiling and Why Does Congress Need to Raise It?
sub_head: Showdown on Capitol Hill could cause federal government to default on debt payments, rattle markets if it isn’t resolved soon
body:
WASHINGTON—The clock is ticking for Congress to reach a long-term deal to raise the federal borrowing limit, or debt ceiling, before the government runs out of money to pay its bills.
The ceiling was suspended in 2019 and was reinstated automatically at the beginning of August. Top Republicans said they wouldn’t help Democrats raise the limit this year, leading to a showdown in Congress. In October, party leaders reached a deal to extend the debt ceiling until early December, and the Senate and House then approved the short-term deal, averting default for the moment.
